title: Mass conservation - speed versus time graph

content.question: An incompressible fluid flows in a clear pipe with circular cross-sections whose diameters vary. A small bead with the same density as the fluid is inside the pipe, moving along with the fluid at the same speed as the fluid. The discontinuous graph shown indicates the speed of the bead as a function of time for the following time intervals: <math alttext="0 to 1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>, <math alttext="2 to 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>, and <math alttext="4 to 5 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>. Which of the following claims is supported by the graph?

choices.label: The radius of the section through which the bead flows is less during <math alttext="0 to 1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> than it is during <math alttext="2 to 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>.

The radius of the section through which the bead flows is greater during <math alttext="2 to 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> than it is during <math alttext="4 to 5 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>.

The radius of the section through which the bead flows during <math alttext="4 to 5 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> is is the largest of all the sections shown.

The radius of the section through which the bead flows during <math alttext="2 to 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> is one-third of the radius of the section through which the bead flows during <math alttext="4 to 5 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>.

content.answer: The radius of the section through which the bead flows during <math alttext="4 to 5 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> is is the largest of all the sections shown.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
